direction.raw_text: You're wrong, Sarah. (RISING) There is a way to defeat Death... and that's to trade places with him. Sibyl turns her head towards the east.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Crow is coming. Judah looks back at Sarah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe comes screaming over a hill on his motorcycle, the image of Judah's face burned into his mind...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: piloted by a man in a devil mask suddenly looms up in front of Ashe. The street ahead has been cordoned off with flashing wooden barricades. There's some kind of street fiesta going on... Ashe swerves, BRAKING HARD to avoid hitting the carriage. Ashe's bike slips out from under him and Ashe goes CRASHING into the barricades. But even as the carriage's skull-faced costumed occupants rush up to help him... ... Ashe is up and running, leaping over the barricades into the crowd beyond...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Crow lands atop the buzzing "JESUS SAVES" sign. It cocks its head, as if considering its next move, then flies toward the campanile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Crow enters through one of the openings in the grillework, settling on one of the rafters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah sits within one of the pools of illumination far below, still bound to the bed by the chain. Judah and Sibyl are nowhere in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: flies down from the rafters, landing on the floor at Sarah's feet. It CAWS at her, trying to communicate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...go...please go... The Crow tilts its head as if trying to understand...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (shaking her chain)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! A steel cage on a wire and pulley system CLATTERS down from above, SLAMMING to the floor and trapping the bird within it. The bird CAWS angrily, flitting from one side of the cage to another, but its efforts are futile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Judah emerges from the darkness, crouching down on the floor to study the Crow. He grins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look who's come home to roost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A massive street festival is under way with Dia de los Muertos
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: mobbing the area. Paper "BIENVENIDOS" banners are strung overhead. CHILDREN light strings of firecrackers. Masked
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in garish costumes dance, MUSICIANS stroll. People are holding giant papier-mache skulls on sticks along with torches and calavera placards. There are stalls offering marigolds and cockscomb, black beeswax tapers, dangling toy skeletons, mountains of calaveras de azucar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pushes through the throng of revelers, invisible amidst the carnival atmosphere. In his makeup he's just another face in the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judah, now carrying the cage which contains the Crow, sweeps aside the curtain of the camera obscura. He reaches up to a lever which opens the camera's lens. Moonlight shines down on the camera table. With another lever, Judah adjusts the camera's view.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The camera lens is now trained on the night sky. A churning landscape of night-sky coulds drifts across the table's surface, creating an eerie effect.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sets a package wrapped in velvet on the camera table. He peels back the cloth, revealing a set of ornately decorated, tapered daggers. He looks back at Sarah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you know what these are called? Misericords. Wonderful name, isn't it? Judah removes one of the blades from its sheath, running the glinting edge along his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the Dark Ages, these were used to deliver the death stroke to the mortally wounded. They were considered tools of mercy. Judah turns to the steel cage in which the Crow has been trapped. He pulls on a leather falconer's glove and opens the door to the cage. The Crow flaps his wings madly, desperately trying to strike at Judah with its beak and claws... ... but Judah secures his grip around the bird's throat, pulling it out. He pins the Crow to the focusing table of the camera obscura with his gloved hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe fights his way through the crowd. A drunken, MASKED WOMAN grabs hold of him, spins him around, dancing. Ashe shoves her aside, making his way to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The black sky beyond shimmers with turbulent yellow thunderheads. The entry way to the tower has been gated and chained. The only way in is up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe grabs a hold of one of the ornamental statues which crowd th ebuildint's facade. He pulls himself up, starting the daunting task of scaling the tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Back to Judah and the Crow. The clouds being projected onto the camera table (and subsequently the Crow itself) are rushing at an unearthly speed. The create a surreal backdrop for the Crow's frenetically beating wings - in effect, a mockery of the bird flying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, little wing. It will all be over soon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe continues to climb. A cluster of PIGEONS take wing, startled from their roost... Ashe pulls back, one of his hands slipping free. He dangles there for a moment, hanging by the tenuous grasp of his fingertips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: who has been lurking in the shadows, suddenly lifts her head up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (full of portent) Ashe is here. Judah grins. This moment has been a long time coming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for long. Judah raises the misericord up high. Sarah turns her head away as... ...Judah plunges the weapon down, pounding it straight through the bird's right wing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten stories up now. Ashe suddenly loses his handhold. He SCREAMS in agony as he suffers the pain of the Crow through their symbiotic link. Ashe stares down at his hand in disbelief...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood seeps from a stigma-like wound on his palm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judah plunges a second misericord into the Crow's left wing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe CRIES OUT again as his left hand is seemingly twisted back against his will. A second stigma wound appears. He slips, tumbling to the next ledge down but catching himself on his fingertips. He hazards a look down...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Day of the Dead CELEBRANTS crowd the streets far below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in agony) ...oh God...help me... It takes every ounce of Ashe's strength to keep from letting go. He tightens his white-knuckled grip on the ledge above. Shaking terribly, trying to fight back the pain, Ashe continues to climb. He reaches up to a...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: which protrudes from the building's facade. The maiden's face has been all but worn bare by the harsh elements. Ashe clutches the back of the maiden in a parody of a lover's embrace. Using the statue for support, he drags himself back up to relative safety. Now Ashe is face to face with the maiden, staring into its blind stone eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah. Ashe whispers the word like a mantra, using it to urge him on. Steeling himself again, fighting the burning pain, Ashe resumes his climb. He's on autopilot now, just trying to reach the campanile, which at this point, seems hopelessly unattainable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: seems to churn and roil. A storm of epic proportions is about to break.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Crow has now been crucified to the camera table, a misericord staked through each wing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Judah reaches for a third misericord. He raises it high above his head, preparing for the coup de grace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashes, ashes, we all fall down... As the dagger comes down we hear...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe Cries out a final time as a GAPING WOUND appears on his chest, BLOOD BLOSSOMING outward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Day of the Dead celebrants swirl around us, Judah's Tower rising up behind the mob - an unholy ziggurat built to challenge the gods. The CROWD has been worked up into a frenzy. Everyone is singing and dancing. MUSIC blasts from loudspeakers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes CRASHING DOWN atop a small vending stall filled to the brim with flowers an sugar skulls. Time slows as a flurry of golder marigold petals flutter down around his still form.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Crow is dead, transfixed by the gleaming misericords. Blood is pooling beneath black flight feathers. Judah steps back, momentarily overwhelmed by the enormity of his crime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's done. Judah looks to the camera obscura's table. The blood from the Crow has completely covered the table's concave surface, filling it to the brim like liquid in a shallow bowl. The end result is an eerie reflecting pool.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: AS WE WATCH, THE IMAGE OF THE CLOUDS

direction.raw_text: cast by the camera lens onto the table begins to ripple and dissolve, only to be replaced by Judah's own, shimmering reflection.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a shaking hand, Judah dips his fingers into the pooling blood and begins to paint his face. A swatch of blood over one eye, then a swatch over the other. A long, bloody smear over his lips... The action harkens back to the moment when Sarah painted Ashe's face - a parallel ritual turned on its head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judah turns towards us, his transformation now complete. We see that he has painted himself a parody of Ashe's irony mask in the Crow's own blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches with a mixture of mounting horror and morbid curiousity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: scoops up a handful of the Crow's blood and brings it to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he drinks, letting the overflow trickle down over his chin and neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his once-pallid features now glow with a kind of beatific radiance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from Judah, up and up into the darkest reaches of his tower. Judah is LAUGHING, laughing in the face of Death itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe lies amidst a field of shimmering glass shards and flowers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: slowly gather around Ashe, craning their necks for a view of the fallen angel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relaxed, peaceful, even. For a moment, we aren't sure whether or not Ashe's soul has fled. The peripheral noise from the street festival dies away. We're in the eye of the hurricane now. Once again, time seems to shudder to a stop. And the only thing we hear are...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thousands of them, filling the heavens with their KEENING WAILS. Ashe slowly opens his eyes, tentative. When you're this deep in the bosom of bliss, the last thing you want to do is waken, but waken he does...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is black with crows. And endless army of carrion-creatures, swirling madly about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe sits up, stares at the crows, fascinated, frightened. Then his eyes fall to the faces of the people around him. We are in dream-time now, blurring the edges of reality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wearing a skull mask pushes to the front of the crowd. He stares at Ashe a moment, then lifts the mask from his face... It's Danny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny...? Ashe rushes to Danny's side, holding him tight, his disbelief overpowered by the unfettered joy of seeing his son once again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time to go back, Dad. Ashe looks up at the screaming crows above them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that why they're here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're the souls who came before you. They're crying for the people they've lost. (BEAT) Now they're crying for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But Sarah still needs me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't understand, Dad. You work for the dead, not the living. Your work here is done. Ashe reaches for his son's shoulders, all but pleading with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't go, not yet, not now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny, I can't leave her like this... The CRIES of the crows grow louder as the sky above becomes darker. A shadow passes over Danny's face. He Seems Saddened. For a moment, it seems as if another entity creeps into Danny's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you turn your back on the dead now, you'll be trapped between the worlds. You'll never be allowed to cross over. (BEAT) You'll be alone, Dad. Forever. Ashe hesitates a moment, realizing the enormity of what he is about to do. It's an agonizing choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to stay. Danny nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Danny reaches out to touch Ashe's painted face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good-bye, Dad. As Danny says his parting words, the SOUNDS of the world around them come rushing back with startling clarity. Danny starts to turn away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danny, wait...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Ashe bolts up from the bed of flowers and glass. The spell is broken. Was he dreaming...? No, there's Danny slipping back into the crows, the mask pulled down over his face once again. Ashe reaches for Danny, spinning him around, pulling off the mask... ...only it's not Danny! It's a drunken DWARF with fucked-up teeth who's laughing his ass of at Ashe. Ashe recoils, horrified, then spins around, suddenly finding himself face to face with...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: standing just a few yards away, emerging from the doorway of his tower. He got the anti-Crow blood mask on his face. His eyes are glowing like twin stars and his lips are curled back in a feral snarl. In his hands, he holds one of the chains from his campanile. Judah grabs Ashe by the lapels of his coat, draging him close so they're eye to eye -- close enough to breathe the same beath
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: two sides of a coin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell me, Ashe. Do you every get the feeling we're all just dead men on leave?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (seething with hatred) Judah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the flesh. Judah flings Ashe backwards... Ashe reaches his hand into his coat, pulling out a .45. He FIRES into Judah's chest - once, twice, thrice... Judah doesn't even stagger, he just keeps on grinning. Wisps of smoke rise up from the holes in his chest. Ashe stares at Judah, dumbfounded.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What...are...you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your shadow, Ashe. Every angel's got a devil. Didn't you know that? Or maybe you just slept your way through Sunday school? Judah lashes out with the rope. Ashe spins and falters. Incredibly, he finds himself feeling pain. Judah follows with a series of blows, each more savage than the next, driving Ashe back... Ashe stumbles, falls to his hands and knees. He reaches to his mouth, his hand comes away spattered with blood. Ashe shakes his head to clear it. Judah kicks Ashe in the face, knocking him onto his back... ...but Ashe springs back to his feet. He tries to strike Judah. Judah catches Ashe's hand and squeezes tight. We hear bones snapping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Judah smashes out with his other fist, Ashe spins around and collapses... Ashe tries to push himself up by his hands. He coughs, spitting up more blood, crawls forward...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What... did you do to me...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've tasted the blood of the Crow and taken your power.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Judah whips the rope about, snapping the end around Ashe's neck, dragging him off his feet. Judah pulls Ashe forward, crouching over him like a spider ready to devour its prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're flesh and blood now, Ashe. You can die like any other man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Already been there. And I must confess, I liked what I saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah sobs quietly, still chained to the pillar. A figure suddenly appears at her side -- Sibyl. Sarah looks up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What...? Sibyl produces a key from within her robes. She places the key in the lock on Sarah's manacles. With a turn of the key, the manacles fall away and Sarah is free. Sarah looks back at the blind oracle, uncertain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you doing this? Sibyl fixes Sarah with her blind stare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe needs you now. More than ever. Sibyl raises her other hand. She's holding one of the misericords which she extends to Sarah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go to him. Sarah takes the misericord and racees for the end of the campanile, towards a beckoning doorway and a stairwell beyond. Printed on a grime-smeared placard nearby are the words...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah rushes through the doorway, heedless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judah plants his foot on Ashe's chest, tightening the chain around Ashe's throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like the dead have forsaken you, my friend. Ashe clutches at the rusty chain links which bite into his flesh, choking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you, bleeding like a stuck pig. Where's your precious strength? Where's your power? (drawing closer, whispering) You're nothing now, Ashe, not even a ghost. Judah rises. He grabs a hold of the chain, pulling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: down the street. Ashe SCREAMS as his body is dragged across the asphalt...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah rushes into a rickety old elevator, pulling the accordion-style security gate shut. She punches the "DOWN" arrow on the tarnished control panel. With a lurch and HUM the elevator car starts its journey downward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judah has dragged Ashe over to the East side of the street, in front of an old movie palace. He leaps atop one of the vending stalls and clambers onto the marquee itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shouts to the crowds below, his eyes on fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You want death?! Here he is, people!!! Take a good look!!! Even as Ashe fights to free himself of the chain, Judah loops one end of it over a street lamp. He jumps from the marquee, using his body weight to pull Ashe from the ground...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is dragged up into the air, dangling above the faces of the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah rushes out the front entrance of the tower, into the Day of the Dead crowd which swarms below. She pushes through the mob, trying to fight her way across the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe swings like a puppet from Judah's improvised hangman's noose. His coat and short have been all but torn to shreds. Judah drags down on the chain harder, lifting Ashe even higher, tightening the noose. He secures the chain on a hydrant, then strolls forward, inspecting his work. Judah circles Ashe, grinning like the cat who swallowed the canary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now don't we look pretty... Ashe struggles, choking, causing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of Danny's that Ashe had kept in his coat pocket to fall free. It flutters to the ground, landing at Judah's feet. Judah kneels, picking it up. As he unfolds the painting, we see that it has been stained with Ashe's own blood. He tilts it this way and that -- as if he were appraising the craftsmanship of the piece.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice. If you prick him, does he not bleed? Judah looks up at Ashe, his eyes full of crazed humor, then he very deliberately tears the painting to shreds, letting the pieces fall away into the night wind. Judah reaches for metal rod, lashing out at Ashe's bare, bloodied back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Ashe SCREAMS. Judah is hell-bent on beating Ashe into oblivion. With every stroke of the switch the crowd CHEERS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes are rolling to whites as consciousness begins to recede...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The swirling faces of the masked celebrants, with Judah front and center. Mob mentality, everyone drunk and LAUGHING, jeering at Ashe, the dangling fool. It's a scene out of Hell... .. and behind Judah, a familiar figure pushing her way to the front of the crowd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lunges forward, clutching the misericord, shoving a reveller aside...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from him! Judah turns. Sarah drives the misericord into Judah's eye. Judah, momentarily blinded, falls back... Sarah unlashes the end of the chain from the hydrant...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: falls to the street as the chain CLATTERS over the street lamp. He unravels the chain from his throat and drags himself back up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah, get back! Too late. Judah has torn the misericord from his eye. He rushes up to Sarah and... ...THUNK! Drives it deep into her chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Sarah gasps, drops to her knees, clutching at the dagger's handle. She pulls the misericord out. Blood begins to well up from the wound. She stares at her blood-covered hands in disbelief, then falls back. Silence now as the crowd begins to back away. The mood has shifted. Ashe drops by Sarah's side. She stares up at the sky, eyes wide with wonder...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The crows...I can see them coming...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Once again, the crows are wheeling around the ceiling of the sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe looks up at Judah, fueled by a righteous rage that's been burning since the moment of his resurrection. He rises. All reason is gone. The only think that remains for Ashe is an unbridled animal fury. Ashe launches himself at Judah, sending the villain tumbling back into a nest of scaffolding. One of the pipes punches clear through Judah's chest, impaling him! Judah hangs there, transfixed like a butterfly with a pin stuck through it. He struggles to pull himself from the piping, but even so, he's laughing hysterically...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't stop me anymore, Ashe. You don't have the power. Ashe's eyes boil with hatred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it were just me, you'd be right, Judah. But I have an eternity of pain to call upon... Ashe lifts his hands up, exposing his bleeding palms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the pain gives me strength.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As we watch the stigmata close themselves up, blood drawing itself back into the wounds. Ashe raises his arms to the sky, gesturing to the crows which spin high above his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The murder of crows spirals down from the sky like a black tidal wave. They descend on Judah as one entity, SCREAMING down from the heavens like a storm of razor blades.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! We get one final glimpse of horrified Judah's face, eyes wide with terror, before the tidal wave of black wings engulfs him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: lets loose a DEATH-SHRIEK that all but splits the sky as the myriad beaks and talons rend him limb from limb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe returns to Sarah's side, lifting her up off the ground and cradling her in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't die, Sarah... I stayed for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a balance that needs to be kept...someone had to cross over... Sarah takes a ragged breath, wincing as a wave of pain washes over her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't want it to be you... Sarah looks up at Ashe, tries her level best to smile. She's at death's door now - one foot already over the threshold. Her face is pale, having lost so much blood. Tears spill down Ashe's cheeks, causing the war-paint makeup to run in rivulets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in anguish) I can't go with you, Sarah. I have to stay here now. (cursing his fate) I have to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you love me? Ashe nods. Sarah reaches down to the wedding ring which hangs from her neck on the chain. She tugs at the chain, snapping it apart. She holds the ring out to Ashe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take...this... Ashe takes the ring from Sarah. She closes Ashe's hand around the ring, gripping his fist tightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll wait for you. Forever, if I have to. She shuts her eyes, riding through another wave of pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen...if two people really love each other... She inhales sharply. Breathing has become a labor for her now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...nothing can keep them apart. (her voice fading) ...nothing. Ashe nods, trying to let this thought reassure him. It's the only thing he has left to cling to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe's face, surrounded by a nimbus of light. We're falling away from him. Down, down, down. And as we fall, we hear a FLUTTERING OF WINGS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her eyes lose focus. Her head goes slack in Ashe's arms. She's gone. Ashe lowers his lips to her, kissing her one final time. Ashe cradles Sarah's lifeless body in his arms, gently rocking back and forth, tears streaming down his cheeks. And as we pull back from them, we realize that the scene mirrors the prophetic image from Sarah's own painting - the woman dying in the arms of her lover, surrounded by a gallery of skull-masked celebrants. Ashe stands, lifting Sarah in his arms. He turns to leave...
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE DAY OF THE DEAD CROWD

direction.raw_text: slowly part for him, revealing a path of marigold petals leading away down the street. It's almost as if, by silent consensus, the crowd has come to understand what has happened here this night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moves through the crowd carrying Sarah in his arms. The people close ranks behind him and we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sibyl stands over the camera obscura. On the table's focusing surface we see the street below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is carrying Sarah in his arms, moving through the crowd of silent witnesses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: nods to herself, satisfied. We see what might be a trace of a smile cross her lips. Sibyl turns and exits the camera obscura.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sibyl approaches the table where the stag beetle is tethered. Removing a pair of scissors from within her robes, Sibyl cuts the thread which binds the beetle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: free at last, quickly scurries out of the box and across the table, disappearing into the shadows. Sibyl follows suit, gathering her robes about her and stepping on into the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same church we visited the night before. Ashe, still carrying Sarah in his arms, enters the sanctuary. The church is aglow with candles. Ashe lays Sarah's body down in front of the offrenda, folding her arms across her chest, leaving her in a state of repose. He stands, taking in one last look. As Ashe moves to leave, he sees the elderly priest he had spoken to earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you still here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I have nowhere left to go. Ashe steps past the priest, moving towards the doorway and the daylight beyond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What will you do, then?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking back) This city is filled with shadows. One more won't make it any darker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe exits the church, finding haven in a shadowed doorway. He reaches into his pocket, removing the wedding ring Sarah had given to him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Ashe turns it over in his hands, seeing the word "FOREVER" inscribed on the inside of the band. He slips it on his finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (CONCERNED) Are you all right? Ashe looks up to see...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the drugged-out girl that Sarah helped at the beginning of the film. She's looking good now, clean of the poison that once possessed her. And damned if she isn't holding Gabriel in her arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long night, huh? Gabriel MEOWS to Ashe. Ashe reaches out and scratches the cat's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't he cool? I found him on the street. I was going to take him home with me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should. Looks like he needs a home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, see ya. She smiles at him and starts off down the street. Gabriel turns around in Grace's arms and peers back at Ashe from over her shoulder. Ashe moves out from the shadows into the steadily growing light, watching them. We see just a hint of hope in his eyes - hope that someday he and Sarah will be reunited. As we hold on Ashe's face, Sarah's VOICE-OVER begins.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I believe there's a place where the restless souls wanter...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The same scene as the beginning of our film. We've made a circle. A heavy mist hangs before us - endless and impenetrable. And out of that primordial fog a CROW materializes, flying towards the camera in slow motion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Burdened by the weight of their own sadness, they cannot enter Heaven... Presently a second shape materializes - a FIGURE ON HORSEBACK, galloping after the Crow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And so they wait, trapped between our world and the next, endlessly searching for a way to rid themselves of their pain - in the hopes that somehow, some day, they will be reunited... As the dark rider comes towards us, we realize that it's Sarah whose baleful eyes are now shining behind the irony mask war paint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) ...with the ones they love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe is back on his bike, racing beneath the cathedral-like arches of the overpass. As he sweeps past a concrete pillar we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sarah on her horse, galloping in parallel action. As she sweeps last a tree we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ashe on the bike. Now we intercut between the two doomed lovers, each on their respective steeds. Worlds apart, and yet, somehow traveling the same road. We are intercutting faster and faster, until the sound of HOOFBEATS and the MOTORCYCLE'S ROAR are indistinguishable. Until the two figures themselves begin to blur. Faster and faster and faster until we...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Over the darkness we hear Sarah's final words to Ashe:
direction.name: direction
